## Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with an 'x' -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] Code follows the project's coding standards (PEP 8 for Python, Rust guidelines)
- [ ] Code has been formatted (`black`, `isort`, `cargo fmt`)
- [ ] Code has been linted (`ruff`, `mypy`, `cargo clippy`)
- [ ] Self-review of code completed
- [ ] Code is well-commented, particularly in complex areas
- [ ] Type hints added for all new Python functions

### Testing

- [ ] New tests added for new features/bug fixes
- [ ] All tests pass locally (`pytest tests/ -v`)
- [ ] Test coverage maintained or improved
- [ ] Edge cases and error conditions tested

### Documentation

- [ ] Documentation updated (README, docstrings, etc.)
- [ ] CHANGELOG updated (if applicable)
- [ ] Comments added for complex logic
- [ ] API documentation updated (if applicable)

### Security

- [ ] No secrets or credentials committed
- [ ] Security scan passed (`bandit`, `safety`)
- [ ] Input validation added where necessary
- [ ] No new security vulnerabilities introduced
- [ ] Followed security best practices from SECURITY.md

### CI/CD

- [ ] CI pipeline passes
- [ ] Build verification successful
- [ ] No breaking changes to existing workflows

### Git Hygiene

- [ ] Commits follow conventional commits format
- [ ] Branch is up to date with base branch
- [ ] Commit messages are clear and descriptive
- [ ] No merge conflicts
